meanings.definition: To cause damage to; harm or injure.
meanings.sent1: Careless driving can endamaged your car.
meanings.sent2: The storm endamaged the roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can endamaged your productivity.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can endamaged your mental well-being.
meanings.sent5: Leaving electronics out in the rain will endamaged them quickly.

meanings.sent1: Without proper care, the delicate flowers will endamaged easily.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's knee endamaged during the game.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much junk food can endamaged your health over time.
meanings.sent4: Lack of sleep can endamaged your ability to focus.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring warning signs can endamaged your safety.
